column4: Does anyone know how I can manage services? I lack the services manager.
check out /etc/init.d/, it contains services, not sure if all of them are there
also try service --status-all
: No 'services' was found, I guess the command isnt known either.
what do you mean no 'services' was found? did the service tool tell you that? huh
No, the tool doesnt even exist on my system.
'service' is the standard way of managing services (daemons) in ubuntu... try 'man service'
My bad, typo. How can I remove gdm (it has a ?) from the services via command line? :)
I dont want to uninstall it, I just want to disable it as I'm running a server and dont need GUI all the time.
: Hm.. apparently it doesn't know the service, even though it's listed.. twice.
what about sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop?
It closes now, but AFAIK it re-appears when I reboot.
Sadly, I already did this. It still re-appears :\
check out update-rc.d
I used sysv-rc-conf and manual deleting. No entries are around, it still starts.
& rob_p: This command throws an error at line 57 :\
you shouldn't delete it, you need to rename it according to some shenanigans, but update-rc.d should do that for you
A reinstall should do the trick for corruption I take it then?
what's corrupted?
: update-rc.d gives an error at line 57 for some reason.
This is still a no-go :(
